design_suggestion.detailed_reference_from_guidelines: Multiple issues identified: 1) Button container wraps a button element inside a div, adding unnecessary complexity and causing layout inconsistencies across window classes. 2) className array includes empty strings when conditions are false. 3) PropTypes should mark required props and include defaultProps. 4) handleClick doesn't validate if clickHandler exists. 5) Missing accessibility attributes (aria-label) for symbol buttons. 6) Icons/symbols should be clear and use standard mathematical notation.

Multiple issues identified: 1) Button '梅' (Chinese character) is unclear and not a standard mathematical symbol - should use '÷'. 2) Multiplication uses 'x' instead of standard '×' symbol. 3) '+/-' should use '±' symbol. 4) 'AC' abbreviation should be 'Clear' for better accessibility. 5) Generic div elements lack semantic structure and ARIA attributes for accessibility. 6) Button rows need explicit grouping with role attributes to prevent elements from moving across window classes. 7) Inconsistent spacing between button rows.

Multiple issues identified: 1) Display lacks proper accessibility attributes (role, aria-live, aria-label) for screen readers. 2) Text may wrap, violating the guideline that label text should remain on a single line for maximum legibility. 3) Missing overflow handling and text truncation. 4) Asymmetric padding reduces information density.

Multiple issues identified: 1) Missing semantic structure and ARIA attributes for accessibility (role='application', aria-label). 2) Layout doesn't explicitly define sections to prevent elements from moving to different UI containers when application state changes or when viewed in different window classes. 3) Needs explicit container structure for display and button sections to maintain consistent positioning across responsive breakpoints.
